description: a(n) = sigma(sigma(n)) = sum of the divisors of the sum of the divisors of n.
comments: If n is prime, a(n) = sigma(n+1) = A000203(n+1). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Feb 14 2014
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..5000
example: a(2)=4 because sigma(2)=1+2=3 and sigma(3)=1+3=4. [_Zak Seidov_, Aug 29 2012]
author: Judson D. Neer (judson(AT)poboxes.com)
